{{ja-kanjitab|わ|ご|yomi=o}}

===Etymology===
Probably a coinage in Japan of {{etyl|ltc|-}}-derived components, as a compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=わご|和|tr1=wa|t1=Japan, Japanese|語|tr2=go|t2=language, word}}.

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|yomi=goon|わご|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

===Alternative forms===
* {{ja-l|倭語}} {{qualifier|rare}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|わご}}

# the Japanese language
# a Japanese word of ancient Japanese origin, such as {{m|ja|見る|tr=miru||to look, to see}}, {{m|ja|光|tr=hikari||shining, brightness}}, or {{m|ja|桜|tr=sakura||cheery tree, cherry blossom}}

====Usage notes====
''Wago'' may be written in [[kanji]], [[kana]], or both, and are read with the {{m|ja|訓読み|tr=kun’yomi||native Japanese reading|lit=meaning reading}}.  Contrast with {{m|ja|漢語|tr=kango||Japanese word of Chinese origin|lit=Han Chinese word}}.
